tool.name: pindel
tool.command:
pindel.py
-r $inputReferenceFile -R $referenceName #if $inputs.mode == 'single': -b $inputs.inputBamFile -t $inputs.sampleTag -bi $inputs.inputBamFile.metadata.bam_index #if $inputs.defineInsertSize.manual_define == "yes": -s $inputs.defineInsertSize.insertSize #end if #end if
#if $inputs.mode == 'pair': -b $inputs.normalInputBamFile -b $inputs.tumorInputBamFile -t NORMAL -t TUMOR -bi $inputs.normalInputBamFile.metadata.bam_index -bi $inputs.tumorInputBamFile.metadata.bam_index #if $inputs.defineInsertSize.manual_define == "yes": -s $inputs.defineInsertSize.normalInsertSize -s $inputs.defineInsertSize.tumorInsertSize #end if #end if
-o1 $outputRawFile -o2 $outputVcfFile #if $inputs.mode == 'pair': -o3 $outputSomaticVcfFile #end if
--number_of_procs \${GALAXY_SLOTS:-4}
--window_size ${window_size} --min_chrom_size $min_chrom_size
#if $reportInversions: --report_inversions #end if #if $reportDuplications: --report_duplications #end if #if $reportLongInsertions: --report_long_insertions #end if #if $reportBreakpoints: --report_breakpoints #end if #if $report_only_close_mapped_reads: -S #end if #if $report_interchromosomal_events: --report_interchromosomal_events #end if -v $min_inversion_size #if str($options_DD.options_DD_selector) == "yes": #if $options_DD.report_close_mapped_reads: -s #end if -q --MAX_DD_BREAKPOINT_DISTANCE $options_DD.MAX_DD_BREAKPOINT_DISTANCE --MAX_DISTANCE_CLUSTER_READS $options_DD.MAX_DISTANCE_CLUSTER_READS --MIN_DD_CLUSTER_SIZE $options_DD.MIN_DD_CLUSTER_SIZE --MIN_DD_BREAKPOINT_SUPPORT $options_DD.MIN_DD_BREAKPOINT_SUPPORT --MIN_DD_MAP_DISTANCE $options_DD.MIN_DD_MAP_DISTANCE #if $options_DD.DD_REPORT_DUPLICATION_READS: --DD_REPORT_DUPLICATION_READS #end if #end if
-d $min_num_matched_bases -x $max_range_index -a $additional_mismatch -m $min_perfect_match_around_BP --sequencing_error_rate $sequencing_error_rate -u $maximum_allowed_mismatch_rate --sensitivity $sensitivity -n $NM #if $NormalSamples: -N #end if -B $balance_cutoff -A $anchor_quality -M $minimum_support_for_event
#if $breakdancer.checking == "yes": --breakdancer $breakdancer.input1 #end if
#if $IndelCorrection: -C #end if
#if $input_SV_Calls_for_assembly.checking == "yes": -z $input_SV_Calls_for_assembly.input_SV_Calls #end if
#if str($exclude_list) != "None": --exclude ${exclude_list} #end if
#if str($include_list) != "None": --include ${include_list} #end if
#if $inputs.mode == 'pair': --somatic_vaf $inputs.somatic_vaf --somatic_cov $inputs.somatic_cov --somatic_hom $inputs.somatic_hom #end if

param.name: referenceName
param.label: Reference Name
param.help: Name of the Reference Genome

param.name: sampleTag
param.label: Tag
param.help: tag for this sample

param.name: insertSize
param.label: Insert size
param.help: insert size of the reads

param.name: normalInsertSize
param.label: Normal Insert size
param.help: insert size of the reads

param.name: tumorInsertSize
param.label: Tumor Insert size
param.help: insert size of the reads

param.name: window_size
param.label: Window size
param.help: for saving RAM, divides the reference in bins of X million bases and only analyzes the reads that belong in the current bin, (default=5 million)

param.name: min_chrom_size
param.label: Minimum chromosome size (bp)
param.help: Set the minimum chromosome size that Pindel will process. Useful for ignoring unassembled contigs. A value of 40000000 will only process chromosomes 1-22,X,Y.

param.name: report_only_close_mapped_reads
param.label: Report only close mapped reads
param.help: do not search for SVs, only report reads of which only one end (the one closest to the mapped read of the paired-end read) could be mapped (the output file can then be used as an input file for another run of pindel, which may save size if you need to transfer files).

param.name: report_interchromosomal_events
param.label: Report interchromosomal events
param.help: search for interchromosomal events. Note: will require the computer to have at least 4 GB of memory

param.name: min_inversion_size
param.label: min inversion size
param.help: only report inversions greater than this number of bases

param.name: MAX_DD_BREAKPOINT_DISTANCE
param.label: MAX DD BREAKPOINT DISTANCE
param.help: Maximum distance between dispersed duplication breakpoints to assume they refer to the same event

param.name: MAX_DISTANCE_CLUSTER_READS
param.label: MAX DISTANCE CLUSTER READS
param.help: Maximum distance between reads for them to provide evidence for a single breakpoint for dispersed duplications

param.name: MIN_DD_CLUSTER_SIZE
param.label: MIN DD CLUSTER SIZE
param.help: Minimum number of reads needed for calling a breakpoint for dispersed duplications

param.name: MIN_DD_BREAKPOINT_SUPPORT
param.label: MIN DD BREAKPOINT SUPPORT
param.help: Minimum number of split reads for calling an exact breakpoint for dispersed duplications

param.name: MIN_DD_MAP_DISTANCE
param.label: MIN DD MAP DISTANCE
param.help: Minimum mapping distance of read pairs for them to be considered discordant

param.name: DD_REPORT_DUPLICATION_READS
param.label: DD REPORT DUPLICATION READS
param.help: Report discordant sequences and positions for mates of reads mapping inside dispersed duplications

param.name: report_close_mapped_reads
param.label: Report close mapped reads
param.help: report reads of which only one end (the one closest to the mapped read of the paired-end read) could be mapped.

param.name: sequencing_error_rate
param.label: Sequencing error rate
param.help: the expected fraction of sequencing errors

param.name: sensitivity
param.label: Sensitivity
param.help: Increasing this parameter to say 0.99 will increase the sensitivity of pindel though you may get more false positives

param.name: balance_cutoff
param.label: balance cutoff
param.help: the number of bases of a SV above which a more stringent filter is applied which demands that both sides of the SV are mapped with sufficiently long strings of bases

param.name: anchor_quality
param.label: anchor quality
param.help: the minimal mapping quality of the reads Pindel uses as anchor If you only need high confident calls, set to 30 or higher

param.name: maximum_allowed_mismatch_rate
param.label: Maximum allowed mismatch rate
param.help: Only reads with more than this fraction of mismatches than the reference genome will be considered as harboring potential SVs.

param.name: max_range_index
param.label: the maximum size of structural variations to be detected
param.help: the higher this number, the greater the number of SVs reported, but the computational cost and memory requirements increase, as does the rate of false positives. 1=128, 2=512, 3=2,048, 4=8,092, 5=32,368, 6=129,472, 7=517,888, 8=2,071,552, 9=8,286,208.

param.name: NM
param.label: NM
param.help: the minimum number of edit distance between reads and reference genome. reads at least NM edit distance (>= NM) will be realigned

param.name: additional_mismatch
param.label: additional mismatch
param.help: Pindel will only map part of a read to the reference genome if there are no other candidate positions with no more than the specified number of mismatches position. The bigger the value, the more accurate but less sensitive (minimum value 1)

param.name: min_perfect_match_around_BP
param.label: min perfect match around BP
param.help: at the point where the read is split into two, there should at least be this number of perfectly matching bases between read and reference

param.name: min_num_matched_bases
param.label: min num matched bases
param.help: only consider reads as evidence if they map with more than X bases to the reference

param.name: NormalSamples
param.label: Normal Samples
param.help: Turn on germline filtering, less sensistive and you may miss somatic calls

param.name: minimum_support_for_event
param.label: minimum support for event
param.help: Pindel only calls events which have this number or more supporting reads

param.name: checking
param.label: use calls from an other method?

param.name: input1
param.label: variant call file
param.help: Pindel is able to use calls from other SV methods such as BreakDancer to further increase sensitivity and specificity. BreakDancer result or calls from any methods must in the format: ChrA LocA stringA ChrB LocB stringB other

param.name: IndelCorrection
param.label: Indel Correction
param.help: search for consensus indels to corret contigs

param.name: input_SV_Calls
param.label: variant call file
param.help: A filename of a list of SV calls for assembling breakpoints Types: DEL, INS, DUP, INV, CTX and ITX File format: Type chrA posA Confidence_Range_A chrB posB Confidence_Range_B Example: DEL chr1 10000 50 chr2 20000 100

param.name: exclude_list
param.label: Exclude File
param.help: Locations to exclude, like centromeres

param.name: include_list
param.label: Include File
param.help: Locations to include, like probe regions
